definition: to go into a huff
surname Shua
to play with/to wield/to act (cool etc)/to display (a skill, one's temper etc)
spleen
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: It's really embarrassing when he acts up in public.
sentences.chinese: 他在外頭耍脾氣，真令我難爲情。

sentences.english: One of the most common forms of acting out behavior is by being passive aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 最常見的耍脾氣是消極對抗。

sentences.english: When sometimes your small kitty, sometimes plays the temperament.
sentences.chinese: 有時候當妳的小貓咪，有時耍脾氣。

sentences.english: Don't be afraid of your child's tears or anger.
sentences.chinese: 不要害怕孩子的眼淚和耍脾氣。

sentences.english: Be careful not to show your temper when dealing with the boss.
sentences.chinese: 今天和老闆打交道的時候，小心點，別耍脾氣。

sentences.english: Acting out is indirectly expressing feelings and emotions through behavior.
sentences.chinese: 耍脾氣是用過行爲間接地表達情緒。

definition: to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
docile and obedient/all obedience
to get angry
to be in a bad mood
to talk back/to answer back
to use force
(Tw) teacher in charge of a class/homeroom teacher
to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
see 驢唇不對馬嘴|驴唇不对马嘴[lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3]
pinyin: niu2 tou2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
lit. to stand with each foot in a different boat (idiom)/fig. to have it both ways/to run after two hares/(especially) to have two lovers at the same time
lit. find a stage, put on a comedy (idiom); to join in the fun/to play along according to local conditions
sneering/sarcasm/cynical remarks
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
